benchmark_details.name: DYPLODOC (Dynamic Plots for Document Classification)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper proposes a dataset consisting of plot descriptions for thirteen thousand TV shows, along with meta-information and dynamic plots extracted from them to facilitate narrative analysis and generation tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset of longer storylines that could be used for narrative research and demonstrate how the notion of the narrative arc could be applied to longer texts.

data.source: TVmaze dataset accessed via the TVmaze API.
data.size: 13,813 TV shows and 21,962 seasons consisting of more than 300,000 episodes
data.annotation: Condensed descriptions of main storylines and annotated genres.

methodology.calculation: Comparison of cluster dynamics with static genre tags for seasons.
methodology.interpretation: Higher mutual information indicates better alignment of dynamic plot features with static genre labels.
methodology.validation: Validation conducted through clustering analysis and comparison with static information.
